channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The vehicle has been parked in a residents bay outside my house for 3 days and has no vehicle registration plates., 13th February
item.description:
I think the vehicle has been abandoned/used in a crime.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sidewood Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Badly Surfaced Road, 13th February
item.description:
This section of the road has been a persistent issue since we moved to the street eight years ago. The surface has continued to deteriorate over time, and it is now in a condition that poses a risk to vehicles. The uneven and damaged surface is beginning to cause wear to car tyres and may also affect suspension components if left unaddressed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chessington Avenue, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes all along Exeter Road N9, 13th February
item.description:
Between Bounces Road and Monmouth Road N9 Exeter Road is full of pothole and cracked tarmac the junction with Cornwallis Grove and Nash Road is particularly bad with a really deep holes here this road resembles Swiss cheese.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Exeter Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low-hanging branch blocking pathway, 13th February
item.description:
A low-hanging branch is encroaching onto the pathway and is forcing pedestrians to step off the path. This may be difficult for some users (e.g., parents pushing buggies) and could create a safety risk for others, such as cyclists or anyone not paying attention (for example, looking at their phone). The location is the dual path with grass field connecting Brenley Gardens - SE9 6LE and Kingsholm Gardens.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brenley Gardens, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2ft pot hole and at least 6-inches deep with sharp edgings, 13th February
item.description:
This pothole had been here for a few weeks but has not drastically got worse over the last 24-hours. A serious accident is certainly likely to happen without repairs as vehicles are swerving last minute and road is also very narrow here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Chislehurst, Greater London
